present_continuous.title: Present Continuous
present_continuous.subtitle: Let's master the Present Continuous (I am doing).
present_continuous.quickLesson:
⚡ Quick Lesson: Present Continuous

1. Concept: Actions happening right now.

2. Structure:

Subject + am/is/are + Verb-ing

3. Key Words: Now, At the moment, Look!, Listen!

4. Examples:
✅ "I am studying English now."
✅ "Look! It is snowing."
❌ "I am wanting water." (Don't use with 'want', 'like', 'know')

explorer.correctSentence: I am playing soccer right now

scholar.correctSentence: I am not listening to music
It is late so we are going home
The children are playing in the park

specialist.original: I (stay) with friends until I find a flat.
specialist.correctSentence: I am staying with friends until I find a flat
You are always losing your keys
She is having a shower right now
The world population is increasing rapidly
I am not feeling well today

specialist.hint: Acting in a certain way now.

past_simple.title: Past Simple
past_simple.subtitle: Finished actions in the past.
past_simple.quickLesson:
⚡ Quick Lesson: Past Simple

1. Concept: Actions finished in the past.

2. Structure:

Verb + ed (Regular) or Irregular

3. Examples:

  • Regular: Walk -> Walked, Play -> Played.
  • Irregular: Go -> Went, Eat -> Ate, See -> Saw.

4. Negative & Question: Use Did / Didn't + Base Verb.
✅ "I went to the park."
✅ "I didn't go to the park." (Not 'didn't went')

scholar.correctSentence: She did not go to the party

scholar.original: I (eat) breakfast, but I (not / drink) coffee.
scholar.correctSentence: I ate breakfast but I did not drink coffee
Did you watch the game last night
scholar.hint: Question format: Did + Subject + Base Verb.

specialist.correctSentence: Why did you not come yesterday

specialist.original: I (read) the book and (write) a report.
specialist.correctSentence: I read the book and wrote a report
specialist.hint: Irregular verbs. 'Read' is spelled same but pronounced 'red'.

specialist.correctSentence: We were very tired last night
She could not find her keys

comparatives.title: Comparatives
comparatives.subtitle: Comparing two things using -er or more.
comparatives.quickLesson:
⚡ Quick Lesson: Comparatives

1. Concept: Comparing two things.

2. Structure:

Adjective + er + than (Short)
more + Adjective + than (Long)

3. Rules:

  • Short (1 syllable): Fast -> Faster.
  • Long (2+ syllables): Beautiful -> More beautiful.
  • Irregular: Good -> Better, Bad -> Worse.

✅ "She is taller than me."

exercises.original: A car is (fast) than a bike.
exercises.correctSentence: A car is faster than a bike
Gold is more expensive than silver
Your English is better than mine

exercises.original: This movie is (bad) than the last one.
exercises.correctSentence: This movie is worse than the last one

explorer.original: An elephant is (big) than a mouse.
explorer.correctSentence: An elephant is bigger than a mouse
My hair is longer than yours

explorer.original: This box is (small) than that one.
explorer.correctSentence: This box is smaller than that one

scholar.original: This test is (easy) than the last one.
scholar.correctSentence: This test is easier than the last one

scholar.original: A Ferrari is (expensive) than a Ford.
scholar.correctSentence: A Ferrari is more expensive than a Ford
She is more beautiful than a rose
English is more important than Latin

specialist.correctSentence: It is getting harder and harder
He is less intelligent than her

modals_can_could.title: Modals: Can & Could
modals_can_could.subtitle: Ability and Possibility (Present vs Past).
modals_can_could.quickLesson:
⚡ Quick Lesson: Can & Could

1. Concept: Ability and Permission.

2. Structure:

Subject + Can/Could + Base Verb

3. Usage:

  • Can: Present ability ("I can swim").
  • Could: Past ability ("I could swim when I was 5").
  • Could: Polite request ("Could you help me?").

explorer.original: When I was young, I (run) fast.
explorer.correctSentence: When I was young I could run fast
She could not find her keys yesterday

scholar.original: I (not / go) to the party last night.
scholar.correctSentence: I could not go to the party last night

specialist.original: We (walk) until the car broke down.
specialist.correctSentence: We could walk until the car broke down
He could run fast when young

future_going_to.title: Future: Going to
future_going_to.subtitle: Talking about plans and intentions.
future_going_to.quickLesson:
⚡ Quick Lesson: Future (Going to)

1. Concept: Plans and Predictions based on what we see.

2. Structure:

am/is/are + going to + Base Verb

3. Usage:

  • Plan: "I am going to buy a car." (I decided this before).
  • Prediction: "Look at the clouds! It is going to rain."

explorer.correctSentence: I am going to visit Paris soon
She is going to buy a car
They are going to play tennis
We are going to watch TV

scholar.correctSentence: What are you going to do next week
I am not going to cook tonight
Where is she going to stay
They are not going to help us
Look out you are going to fall

specialist.original: I have decided. I (look) for a new job.
specialist.correctSentence: I am going to look for a new job

specialist.original: (Apply) for the job? Yes, I am.
specialist.correctSentence: Are you going to apply for the job
I am not going to tell him the secret
She is going to have a baby next month

present_simple_be.title: Present Simple (Be)
present_simple_be.subtitle: Verb To Be (Am, Is, Are).
present_simple_be.quickLesson:
⚡ Quick Lesson: To Be (Present)

1. Concept: Used to describe who or what something is (identity, feelings, location).

2. Structure:

Subject + am / is / are + Adjective/Noun

3. Usage:

  • I am (I'm)
  • He/She/It is (He's/She's)
  • You/We/They are (You're/They're)

4. Examples:
✅ "I am happy."
✅ "She is a doctor."
✅ "They are at home."

specialist.correctSentence: You and I are a team
Ten miles is a long way
My glasses are on the table

present_simple_verbs.title: Present Simple (Verbs)
present_simple_verbs.subtitle: Habits and Routines (-s for He/She/It).
present_simple_verbs.quickLesson:
⚡ Quick Lesson: Present Simple

1. Concept: Habits, routines, and general facts.

2. Structure:

Subject + Verb (+ s for He/She/It)

3. Usage:

  • I/You/We/They: Walk, Like, Do.
  • He/She/It: Walks, Likes, Does.

4. Examples:
✅ "I drink coffee every day." (Habit)
✅ "She likes pizza." (Fact)
❌ "He like pizza." (Missing 's')

specialist.correctSentence: The sun rises in the east
He washes his car on Sundays

past_simple_be.title: Past Simple (Be)
past_simple_be.subtitle: Verb To Be in Past (Was, Were).
past_simple_be.quickLesson:
⚡ Quick Lesson: To Be (Past)

1. Concept: Descriptions in the past.

2. Structure:

Was (Singular) / Were (Plural)

3. Usage:

  • I / He / She / It: was
  • You / We / They: were

4. Examples:
✅ "I was tired yesterday."
✅ "They were happy."
✅ "Where were you?"

specialist.correctSentence: The weather was terrible last week

specialist.original: There (be) a spider on the wall.
specialist.correctSentence: There was a spider on the wall

specialist.original: My car (be) broken, so I walked.
specialist.correctSentence: My car was broken so I walked

articles.title: Articles (A/An/The)
articles.subtitle: Determiners (A book, An apple, The sun).
articles.quickLesson:
⚡ Quick Lesson: Articles (A, An, The)

1. Concept: Defining nouns.

2. Rules:

  • A: General singular constant sound ("A car", "A book").
  • An: General singular vowel sound ("An apple", "An hour").
  • The: Specific/Known things ("The sun", "The book on the table").
  • No Article: General plural/uncountable ("I like cats", "I drink water").

scholar.correctSentence: I want to be an actor

specialist.correctSentence: I am going to the USA
The rich should help the poor

personal_pronouns.title: Personal Pronouns
personal_pronouns.subtitle: Subject / Object (I/Me, He/Him).
personal_pronouns.quickLesson:
⚡ Quick Lesson: Personal Pronouns

1. Concept: Words that replace names.

2. Subject vs Object:

Subject (Act): I, You, He, She, It, We, They
Object (Receive): Me, You, Him, Her, It, Us, Them

3. Examples:
✅ "He calls her." (Subject calls Object)
✅ "She likes us."

scholar.correctSentence: This belongs to you and me

scholar.hint: Common usage (though strictly formal is 'she'). Use 'her'.

specialist.correctSentence: Nobody but him offered to help
She is taller than I am

specialist.hint: Dialect/Old: Give it him (Direct Object + Indirect Object).

possessive_adjectives.title: Possessive Adjectives
possessive_adjectives.subtitle: My, Your, His, Her.
possessive_adjectives.quickLesson:
⚡ Quick Lesson: Possessive Adjectives

1. Concept: Showing ownership.

2. List:

  • I -> My ("My book")
  • You -> Your
  • He -> His
  • She -> Her
  • It -> Its
  • We -> Our
  • They -> Their

✅ "This is my car." (Not 'I car' or 'mine car')

explorer.original: I have a car. (I) car is red.
You have a pen. (You) pen is blue.
He has a dog. (He) dog is big.
She has a cat. (She) cat is nice.
We have a house. (We) house is old.
They have a ball. (They) ball is round.

specialist.correctSentence: It is their decision not ours

prepositions_time.title: Prepositions of Time
prepositions_time.subtitle: In, On, At.
prepositions_time.quickLesson:
⚡ Quick Lesson: Prepositions of Time

1. Usage:

  • IN: Long periods (Months, Years, Seasons).
    "In 1990", "In July", "In the morning".
  • ON: Days and Dates.
    "On Monday", "On July 4th".
  • AT: Precise time.
    "At 5 o'clock", "At night", "At the weekend".

Mnemonic: In (Big) > On (Medium) > At (Small).

explorer.hint: Preposition for parts of the day.

scholar.correctSentence: What do you do at Christmas
He left on the 4th of July

specialist.correctSentence: She has been here since Monday

prepositions_place.title: Prepositions of Place
prepositions_place.subtitle: In, On, At, Under.
prepositions_place.quickLesson:
⚡ Quick Lesson: Prepositions of Place

1. Usage:

  • IN: Inside/Enclosed.
    "In the box", "In London", "In the car".
  • ON: Surface/Lines.
    "On the table", "On the wall", "On a bus".
  • AT: Specific Point.
    "At the door", "At the bus stop", "At home".

explorer.correctSentence: The cat is in the box
The book is on the table

scholar.correctSentence: The bank is opposite the park
He is in front of me

plural_nouns.title: Plural Nouns
plural_nouns.subtitle: Regular and Common Irregular.
plural_nouns.quickLesson:
⚡ Quick Lesson: Plural Nouns

1. Concept: More than one.

2. Rules:

  • +s (Most): Cat -> Cats.
  • +es (End in s, x, ch, sh): Box -> Boxes.
  • y -> ies (Consonant+y): Baby -> Babies.
  • Irregular: Man->Men, Woman->Women, Child->Children, Tooth->Teeth, Person->People.

specialist.hint: Strictly plural (Datum), though singular often accepted. Use 'are' for formal accuracy.

question_words.title: Question Words
question_words.subtitle: Who, What, Where, When, Why, How.
question_words.quickLesson:
⚡ Quick Lesson: Question Words

1. List:

  • Who: Person ("Who is he?")
  • What: Thing/Action ("What is that?")
  • Where: Place ("Where do you live?")
  • When: Time ("When is lunch?")
  • Why: Reason ("Why are you sad?")
  • How: Method/Manner ("How are you?")
